meanings.definition: strict or severe in manner or attitude
meanings.sent1: The teacher gave a stern look to the misbehaving student.
meanings.sent2: The principal had a stern expression during the school assembly.
meanings.sent3: Despite his stern tone, the coach's heart was full of kindness.
meanings.sent4: Her stern instructions left no room for misunderstanding.
meanings.sent5: The stern warning made everyone pay attention.

meanings.definition: the rear part of a ship
meanings.sent1: The sailors gathered at the stern of the ship to watch the sunset.
meanings.sent2: The captain stood proudly at the stern, steering the ship.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls perched on the stern, enjoying the ocean breeze.
meanings.sent4: The waves crashed against the stern as the ship sailed forward.
meanings.sent5: The flag fluttered at the stern, signaling the ship's nationality.

meanings.definition: the back or rear of anything
meanings.sent1: She placed the heavy box at the stern of the truck.
meanings.sent2: The hikers sat at the stern of the trail to rest and enjoy the view.
meanings.sent3: The cat curled up at the stern of the sofa for a nap.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted intricate designs on the stern of the vase.
meanings.sent5: The last car of the train was at the stern, slowly disappearing into the distance.
